body:
@yegor256 Here you are.

```
Exception in thread "main" java.io.IOException: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: smtp.gmail.com, port: 465, response: -1
    at com.jcabi.email.wire.SMTP.connect(SMTP.java:107)
    at com.jcabi.email.Postman$Default.send(Postman.java:129)
    at Email.main(Email.java:24)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
    at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
    at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
    at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:497)
    at com.intellij.rt.execution.application.AppMain.main(AppMain.java:140)
Caused by: javax.mail.MessagingException: Could not connect to SMTP host: smtp.gmail.com, port: 465, response: -1
    at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.openServer(SMTPTransport.java:1949)
    at com.sun.mail.smtp.SMTPTransport.protocolConnect(SMTPTransport.java:654)
    at javax.mail.Service.connect(Service.java:295)
    at com.jcabi.email.wire.SMTP.connect(SMTP.java:100)
    ... 7 more
```

I didn't attach the source code as it's basically the copy&paste from http://email.jcabi.com/
@piotrkot hm... no idea. maybe wrong password?
I even created a brand new google account. Sending emails works only with Apache code.

@yegor256 Apache call to `email.setSSLOnConnect(true);` is important and missing in jcabi.
That is `com.jcabi.email.wire.SMTP` class does not set all properties in session (method `connect()`).
Providing them as program arguments is not going to work either. What is required is to add them to `connect()` method.
Apache sets the following properties:

```
-Dmail.smtp.port=465
-Dmail.smtp.ssl.checkserveridentity=true
-Dmail.smtp.socketFactory.class=javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory
-Dmail.smtp.socketFactory.port=465
-Dmail.smtp.socketFactory.fallback=false
```

After the above mentioned changes, sending with jcabi is successful.
@piotrkot maybe you can submit a pull request since you know what the problem is?

@yegor256 Just a few thoughts. Gmail requires SMTP with SSL. All you have is `SMTP Postman`. For that I suggest creating new class `SMTPS Postman` implementing `Wire`. Unfortunately, `SimpleSMTPServer` from dumbster doesn't support SSL. What do you think about using another server for testing? How about [javamail-mock2](https://github.com/salyh/javamail-mock2)?
